title: You're probably taking over-the-counter painkillers incorrectly

titles: You're probably taking over-the-counter painkillers incorrectly
constructiveness_reason: This story provides actionable insights for the reader about the correct use of over-the-counter painkillers, contributing to their decision-making and sense of agency. It also increases awareness about a common health issue.
summary: Pharmacists warn that incorrect use or overconsumption of painkillers such as Advil and Tylenol can lead to increased side effects. They recommend safer and more effective methods for taking these medications to mitigate risks.

title: Why Russia’s invasion of Ukraine hangs over tennis like no other sport
snippets: It’s easy to think of tennis’ relationship with Russia’s war in Ukraine through the prism of a few key moments. Russian player Andrey Rublev wrote “no war please” on a camera lens in February 2022, shortly after Russia’s invasion. In September 2022, Daria Kasatkina, also Russian, described the war as a “full-blown nightmare” in a series of interviews in which she also came out as gay. Kasatkina earlier this year defected to Australia, saying in a news conference, “if I want to be myself, I have
titles: Why Russia’s invasion of Ukraine hangs over tennis like no other sport
summary: Russian tennis players have publicly responded to their country's invasion of Ukraine, highlighting the sport's engagement with the conflict. Andrey Rublev called for peace by writing “no war please” on a camera lens in February 2022. Daria Kasatkina, who described the war as a “full-blown nightmare” and came out as gay, defected to Australia to live authentically. These actions underscore the personal and political challenges faced by athletes amidst global events.

title: Watch These AMD Price Levels as Stock Slides Amid New U.S. Rules on Chip Exports to China
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • AMD shares fell again Thursday, a day after the chipmaker joined a sector-wide sell-off following news that the U.S. had imposed new licensing requirements on some AI chip exports to China.
  • The stock has recently formed a piercing pattern, a two-day candlestick price pattern that marks a potential reversal from a downward trend to an upward trend.
  • Investors should watch major support levels on AMD's chart around $76 and $65, while also monitoring key resistance levels near $116 and $150.


Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares lost ground again Thursday, a day after the chipmaker joined a sector-wide sell-off following news that the U.S. had imposed new licensing requirements on some AI chip exports to China.

AMD said via a regulatory filing that the new chip curbs would see it face charges of up to $800 million related to the export of its MI308 graphics processing unit (GPU), a chip designed for compute-intensive applications, such as AI and gaming.

AMD shares have tumbled 28% since the start of the year and lost 43% of their value over the past 12 months amid concerns about slowing AI infrastructure spending and the company’s inability to capture a greater share of the AI chip market from sector bellwether Nvidia (NVDA). The Trump administration's trade policies have added to the uncertainty surrounding the stock.

Below we analyze AMD’s weekly chart and identify major price levels that investors will likely be watching.

Piercing Pattern Marks Potential Reversal

After breaking down below the neckline of a head and shoulders formation in December, AMD shares trended sharply lower until last week’s volume-backed rebound, potentially laying the groundwork for a longer-term reversal.

Importantly, the move created a piercing pattern, a two-day candlestick price pattern that marks a potential reversal from a downward trend to an upward trend.

However, selling resumed this week, with the relative strength index (RSI) edging back toward oversold levels to confirm bearish short-term price momentum. Looking ahead, investors should watch for the indicator to potentially break out above a falling wedge pattern it has formed over the past seven months.

Let’s locate major support and resistance levels by applying technical analysis to AMD’s chart.

Major Support Levels to Watch

AMD shares fell 0.9% to $87.50 on Thursday.

The first lower level to watch sits around $76. This area would likely attract significant scrutiny near last week’s low, which also closely aligns with a range of corresponding trading activity on the chart stretching back to September 2020.

Selling below this level opens the door for a retest of lower support at $65. Investors could seek buying opportunities in this location near the December 2022 retracement low, a region the marked the start of a 14-month uptrend in the stock.

Important Resistance Levels to Watch

A move higher from current levels could see the shares initially climb to around $116. This region provides a confluence of selling pressure near the 200-week moving average, last month’s countertrend high, and a range of comparable price points on the chart extending back to August 2021.

Finally, a longer-term trend reversal in the stock could fuel a rally to $150. Investors who have accumulated shares during the stock’s downtrend may look for profit-taking opportunities in this location near a horizontal line that connects several minor peaks on the chart between December 2021 and August last year. Depending on the timing of such a move, AMD shares may also encounter resistance in this area from the head and shoulders’ neckline.

The comments, opinions, and analyses expressed on Investopedia are for informational purposes only. Read our warranty and liability disclaimer for more info.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.
titles: Watch These AMD Price Levels as Stock Slides Amid New U.S. Rules on Chip Exports to China
summary: AMD shares fell by 0.9% to $87.50 on Thursday, continuing a decline after the U.S. imposed new licensing requirements on AI chip exports to China, affecting the chipmaker. This regulatory action could result in up to $800 million in charges for AMD due to restrictions on its MI308 GPU exports. The stock has seen a significant drop, losing 28% since the start of the year and 43% over the past 12 months, amid concerns over AI infrastructure spending and competition from Nvidia. Technical analysis suggests watching for major support levels at $76 and $65, with key resistance levels near $116 and

title: What Analysts Think of Tesla Stock Ahead of Earnings
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Tesla will report first-quarter earnings after the market closes on Tuesday as analysts remain divided on the electric vehicle maker.
  • Revenue and adjusted profits are expected to fall year-over-year as deliveries and production have disappointed.
  • The EV maker's stock has suffered as the company has been the center of protests and controversy over CEO Elon Musk's political efforts.


Tesla (TSLA) is scheduled to post its first-quarter earnings report after Tuesday's bell. Analysts are divided on the electric vehicle maker leading up to the results.

Analysts tracked by Visible Alpha are split have 10 "buy" ratings, four "hold," and four "sell" ratings. Ahead of last quarter's report, the distribution was nine "buy," six "hold," and three "sell" ratings.

The mean price target, $314.41 per Visible Alpha data, represents about a 30% premium to its close on Thursday, the last trading day of a holiday-shortened week—but its recent levels but down nearly $50 from the average prior to last quarter's earnings.

Tesla is expected to report a less than 1% decline in revenue to $21.18 billion, with adjusted earnings per share (EPS) forecast to fall by nearly 8% year-over-year to $0.42. That estimate has been cut by over 16%, while the adjusted EPS consensus estimate has fallen by over 40% since last quarter's report was released.

Deliveries, Production Fell Short Amid Political Concerns

Earlier this week, Reuters reported that the company has paused shipments of parts from China for its semi trucks and Cybercab robotaxi called the because of the Trump administration's tariffs, potentially delaying production and release of the vehicles.

The company's deliveries and production numbers fell short of estimates for the second straight quarter when they were released earlier this month. The EV maker has also been the center of protests and controversy regarding CEO Elon Musk's involvement in the Trump administration. Sales have declined in several key markets this year.

Tesla stock was one of the worst performers in the S&P 500 in the first quarter. Analysts, including even those most bullish have cut estimates for deliveries and profits this year, along with price targets. Some have called for Musk to step back from his political efforts to focus on Tesla as the stock has slid.

Tesla shares have roughly returned to their pre-election levels around $240, falling from a Dec. 17 record close of $479.86.
titles: What Analysts Think of Tesla Stock Ahead of Earnings
summary: Tesla is set to release its first-quarter earnings report after the market closes on Tuesday, with expectations of a slight decline in revenue to $21.18 billion and an 8% drop in adjusted earnings per share to $0.42. This downturn follows a period of underwhelming delivery and production numbers, alongside controversies surrounding CEO Elon Musk's political activities. The company's stock has been negatively impacted, being one of the worst performers in the S&P 500 for the first quarter. Analysts' opinions on Tesla are mixed, with adjustments to profit and delivery estimates, as well as price

title: A classic hacking technique works on some quantum computers

titles: A classic hacking technique works on some quantum computers
summary: Two independent research teams have created techniques to hack noisy quantum computers using a row-hammer attack, which is traditionally employed to compromise conventional computers. This development highlights potential security vulnerabilities in quantum computing systems.

titles: NFL draft RB rankings: Top 10 best available include Ashton Jeanty, Omarion Hampton, Cam Skattebo
summary: The 2025 NFL Draft is set to start on April 24, with Ashton Jeanty leading The Tennessean's list of the top 10 running backs available for selection.

title: NFL draft QB rankings: Top 10 best available include Cam Ward, Shedeur Sanders, Tyler Shough
snippets: The 2025 NFL Draft begins on April 24. Here are The Tennessean's rankings for the 10 best quarterbacks available, starting with Cam Ward and Shedeur Sanders.
titles: NFL draft QB rankings: Top 10 best available include Cam Ward, Shedeur Sanders, Tyler Shough
summary: The 2025 NFL Draft is set to start on April 24, with Cam Ward and Shedeur Sanders leading The Tennessean's rankings of the top 10 available quarterbacks. This list is a key indicator of the talent pool for teams looking to strengthen their quarterback positions.

title: Chelsea could sell two first team defenders to fund move for Premier League captain valued at “under £50m”
snippets: Now that Wesley Fofana’s injury problems have ruled him out from ever being a reliable Premier League player in the long run, it’s pretty clear that Chelsea are getting into gear to try and sign a...
titles: Chelsea could sell two first team defenders to fund move for Premier League captain valued at “under £50m”
summary: Wesley Fofana's persistent injury issues have led to concerns about his long-term reliability in the Premier League. As a result, Chelsea is actively seeking a replacement. The specifics of the potential signing, including the target player or the timeline, were not disclosed.

title: Trent Alexander-Arnold set for Liverpool return but his future remains unclear
snippets: Trent Alexander-Arnold could return to the Liverpool squad this weekend following injury but Reds boss Arne Slot again did not give any clarification on the defender’s future.Alexander-Arnold is out...
titles: Trent Alexander-Arnold set for Liverpool return but his future remains unclear
summary: Trent Alexander-Arnold may rejoin the Liverpool squad for the upcoming weekend after recovering from an injury. However, Liverpool's manager, Arne Slot, has not provided any details regarding the defender's long-term future with the team. The current status of Alexander-Arnold's situation remains uncertain as he potentially prepares for a return to play.
